definition: to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
component in Chinese characters/archaic variant of 毫[hao2]/archaic variant of 乙[yi3]
variant of 包紮|包扎[bao1 za1]
to wrap up/to pack/to bind up (a wound)
variant of 包紮|包扎[bao1 za1]
to wrap up/to pack/to bind up (a wound)

sentences.english: It was a cool, misty morning when we woke near Uvinza.
sentences.chinese: 我们在乌温扎附近醒来，这是一个凉爽有雾的早晨。

sentences.english: ' " Naturally, he bought a sack of salt from Uvinza.
sentences.chinese: 自然，他从乌温扎买了一袋盐。

sentences.english: Moment such as sting, tight at mind, again difficult pull out.
sentences.chinese: 瞬间如刺，扎在了心上，再难拔除。

sentences.english: Applying needles at pressure points is thought to trigger electrical pulses that suppress appetite.
sentences.chinese: 将细针扎在压力穴可以诱发抑制食欲的神经电脉冲。

sentences.english: We can talk about Lamar Odom and Hedo Turkoglu and Trevor Ariza.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以谈到奥多姆，特克德鲁还有阿里扎。

sentences.english: We looked to our left and this thing started surfing towards us and we just headed straight to the beach.
sentences.chinese: 我们向左这使得我们被浪冲起来然后一头扎向海滩。

sentences.english: A guard opened the door of the train and the Commander got in.
sentences.chinese: 一个卫兵打开火车门，扎达克跨了进去。

sentences.english: She pricked her finger on/with a needle.
sentences.chinese: 她的手指叫针给扎伤了。

sentences.english: Maradona also praised Javier Zanetti for his reaction to losing the captaincy .
sentences.chinese: 马拉多纳同样表扬了扎内蒂失去队长袖标之后的反应。

sentences.english: Mr. Destito moved toSyracuse eight years ago.
sentences.chinese: Destito先生八年前搬到了锡拉库扎。

sentences.english: But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and forthwith came there out blood and water.
sentences.chinese: 惟有一个兵拿枪扎他的肋旁，随即有血和水流出来。

sentences.english: Bar Janvier is located about 50 kilometers west of Tripoli.
sentences.chinese: 扎维耶位于的黎波里以西约50公里处。

sentences.english: In the coming years, Zewail looks forward to more breakthroughs.
sentences.chinese: 扎威尔期望今后几年里能再有突破性的成果。

sentences.english: We all pitched in , and within an hour the whole camp was set up.
sentences.chinese: 我们拼命干起来，一小时内就扎好了营。

sentences.english: It's this side of her that endears Condoleezza to her friends.
sentences.chinese: 正是她的这一面，使康多莉扎备受朋友的喜爱。

sentences.english: Loyalist forces using tanks and rockets outgunned the rebel groups.
sentences.chinese: 扎卡菲拥护者使用坦克和火箭重火力压倒了反对者。

definition: pigtail/(fig.) a shortcoming or evidence of wrongdoing that can be seized upon by others

ponytail (hairstyle)/horse's tail/slender fibers like horse's tail (applies to various plants)

to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull
